types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

fields.name: image
fields.description: Associated image. Image cannot be disassociated after creating association with component.

fields.name: mime_type
fields.description: When used on file components, the mime-type can provide additional context about the kind of file being represented such as an image, font, or executable. Some library or framework components may also have an associated mime-type.

fields.name: bom_ref
fields.description: An identifier which can be used to reference the component elsewhere in the BOM. Uniqueness within the BOM is ensured checking unique combination od manifest._id and bom_ref.

fields.name: supplier
fields.description: The organization that supplied the component. The supplier may often be the manufacturer, but may also be a distributor or repackager.

fields.name: author
fields.description: The person(s) or organization(s) that authored the component.

fields.name: publisher
fields.description: The person(s) or organization(s) that published the component.

fields.name: group
fields.description: The grouping name or identifier. This will often be a shortened, single name of the company or project that produced the component, or the source package or domain name. Whitespace and special characters should be avoided. Examples: apache, org.apache.commons, and apache.org.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the component. This will often be a shortened, single name of the component. Examples: commons-lang3 and jquery

fields.name: version
fields.description: The component version. The version should ideally comply with semantic versioning but is not enforced.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Specifies a description for the component.

fields.name: scope
fields.description: Specifies the scope of the component.

fields.name: hashes
fields.description: Hashes of the component.

fields.name: licenses
fields.description: Licenses of the component.

fields.name: copyright
fields.description: A copyright notice informing users of the underlying claims to copyright ownership in a published work.

fields.name: purl
fields.description: Specifies the package-url (purl). The purl, if specified, MUST be valid and conform to the specification defined at: https://github.com/package-url/purl-spec

fields.name: swid
fields.description: Specifies metadata and content for ISO-IEC 19770-2 Software Identification (SWID) Tags. https://www.iso.org/standard/65666.html

fields.name: external_references
fields.description: External references provide a way to document systems, sites, and information that may be relevant but which are not included with the BOM.

fields.name: evidence
fields.description: Provides the ability to document evidence collected through various forms of extraction or analysis.

fields.name: release_notes
fields.description: Specifies optional release notes.

fields.name: build_dependency
fields.description: Defines if the container is used as a build dependency during multi-stage builds.

fields.name: properties
fields.description: Provides the ability to document properties in a name-value store. This provides flexibility to include data not officially supported in the standard without having to use additional namespaces or create extensions. Unlike key-value stores, properties support duplicate names, each potentially having different values. Property names of interest to the general public are encouraged to be registered in the CycloneDX Property Taxonomy (https://github.com/CycloneDX/cyclonedx-property-taxonomy). Formal registration is OPTIONAL.

types.name: ContainerImageInput
types.description: Metadata about images contained in RedHat and ISV repositories

inputFields.name: architecture
inputFields.description: The field contains an architecture for which the container image was built for. Value is used to distinguish between the default x86-64 architecture and other architectures. If the value is not set, the image was built for the x86-64 architecture.

inputFields.name: brew
inputFields.description: Brew related metadata.

inputFields.name: cloud_service
inputFields.description: Indication that image was created by the CPaaS managed service pipeline.

inputFields.name: container_grades
inputFields.description: Information about the state of grading of particular image.

inputFields.name: content_manifest
inputFields.description: Subset of data from contentManifest.

inputFields.name: content_sets
inputFields.description: A list of all content sets (YUM repositories) from where an image RPM content is.

inputFields.name: cpe_ids
inputFields.description: A mapping of applicable advisories to RPM NEVRA. This data is required for scoring.

inputFields.name: cpe_ids_rh_base_images
inputFields.description: A mapping of applicable advisories for the base_images from the Red Hat repositories.

inputFields.name: docker_image_digest
inputFields.description: Docker Image Digest. For Docker 1.10+ this is also known as the 'manifest digest'.

inputFields.name: docker_image_id
inputFields.description: Docker Image ID. For Docker 1.10+ this is also known as the 'config digest'.

inputFields.name: freshness_grades
inputFields.description: The grade based on applicable updates and time provided by PST CVE engine.

inputFields.name: parsed_data
inputFields.description:
Data parsed from image metadata.
These fields are not computed from any other source.

inputFields.name: repositories
inputFields.description: Published repositories associated with the container image.

inputFields.name: certified
inputFields.description: Indication if the image was certified.

inputFields.name: deleted
inputFields.description: Indicates that an image was removed. Only unpublished images can be removed.

inputFields.name: image_id
inputFields.description:
Image manifest digest.
Be careful, as this value is not unique among container image entries, as one image can be references several times.

inputFields.name: isv_pid
inputFields.description: ID of the project in for ISV repositories. The ID can be also used to connect vendor to the image.

inputFields.name: sum_layer_size_bytes
inputFields.description: The total size of the sum of all layers for each image in bytes. This is computed externally and may not match what is reported by the image metadata (see parsed_data.size).

inputFields.name: top_layer_id
inputFields.description: Field for multiarch primary key

inputFields.name: uncompressed_top_layer_id
inputFields.description: Hash (sha256) of the uncompressed top layer for this image (should be same value as - parsed_data.uncompressed_layer_sizes.0.layer_id)

inputFields.name: raw_config
inputFields.description: Raw image configuration, such as output from docker inspect.

inputFields.name: _id
inputFields.description: MongoDB unique _id

inputFields.name: creation_date
inputFields.description: The date when the entry was created. Value is created automatically on creation.

inputFields.name: last_update_date
inputFields.description: The date when the entry was last updated.

inputFields.name: nvra

inputFields.name: package
inputFields.description: A package name in Brew.

inputFields.name: status_message

inputFields.name: exception_approved

inputFields.name: exception_approved_description
inputFields.description: Description and reference to a Jira ticket with an approved exception

inputFields.name: _id
inputFields.description: ID of the contentManifest.

types.name: FreshnessGradeInput
types.description: Grade based on applicable updates and time provided by PST CVE engine.

inputFields.name: end_date
inputFields.description: Date after which the grade is no longer valid. See start_date for when the grade was effective. If no value is set, the grade applies forever. This should happen only for a grade of A (no vulnerabilities) or grade F.

inputFields.name: grade
inputFields.description: The grade.

inputFields.name: creation_date
inputFields.description: Date when the grade was added by the vulnerability engine.

inputFields.name: start_date
inputFields.description: Date from which the grade is in effect. The grade is effective until the end_date, if end_date is set.

inputFields.name: created
inputFields.description: The 'created' date reported by image metadata. Stored as String because we do not have control on that format.

inputFields.name: docker_version
inputFields.description: Version of docker reported by 'docker inspect' for this image.

inputFields.name: layers
inputFields.description: Layer digests from the image.

inputFields.name: repos
inputFields.description: Repositories defined within an image as reported by yum command.

inputFields.name: size
inputFields.description: Size of this image as reported by image metadata.

inputFields.name: uncompressed_layer_sizes
inputFields.description: Information about uncompressed layer sizes.

inputFields.name: uncompressed_size_bytes
inputFields.description: Uncompressed images size in bytes (sum of uncompressed layers size).

inputFields.name: user
inputFields.description: The user on the images.

inputFields.name: virtual_size
inputFields.description: Virtual size of this image as reported by image metadata.

inputFields.description: Value of the label.

inputFields.name: layer_id
inputFields.description: The SHA256 layer ID.

inputFields.name: size_bytes
inputFields.description: The uncompressed layer size in bytes.

inputFields.name: comparison
inputFields.description: Store information about image comparison.

inputFields.description: The _id's of the redHatContainerAdvisory that contains the content advisories.

inputFields.name: image_advisory_id
inputFields.description: The _id of the redHatContainerAdvisory that contains the image advisory.

inputFields.name: manifest_list_digest
inputFields.description: Available for multiarch images.

inputFields.name: manifest_schema2_digest
inputFields.description: Available for single arch images.

inputFields.name: published
inputFields.description: Indicate if the image has been published to the container catalog.

inputFields.name: published_date
inputFields.description: Date the image was published to the container catalog.

inputFields.name: push_date
inputFields.description: When the image was pushed to this repository. For RH images this is picked from first found of advisory ship_date, brew completion_date, and finally repositories publish_date. For ISV images this replicates value of published_date.

inputFields.name: registry
inputFields.description: Hostname of the registry where the repository can be accessed.

inputFields.name: repository
inputFields.description: Repository name.

inputFields.name: signatures
inputFields.description: Image signing info.

inputFields.description: Mapping of a NVRA to multiple advisories IDs.

inputFields.name: reason_text
inputFields.description: Human readable reason.

inputFields.name: rpms

inputFields.name: with_nvr
inputFields.description: NVR of image which this image was compared with.

inputFields.name: advisory_ids
inputFields.description: Content advisory ID.

types.description: Stores software and hardware components associated with image manifests. Structure is based on the CycloneDX component. Link: https://cyclonedx.org/docs/1.4/json/#components

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description: Specifies the type of component. For software components, classify as 'application' if no more specific appropriate classification is available or cannot be determined for the component.

inputFields.name: image
inputFields.description: Associated image. Image cannot be disassociated after creating association with component.

inputFields.description: When used on file components, the mime-type can provide additional context about the kind of file being represented such as an image, font, or executable. Some library or framework components may also have an associated mime-type.

inputFields.name: bom_ref
inputFields.description: An identifier which can be used to reference the component elsewhere in the BOM. Uniqueness within the BOM is ensured checking unique combination od manifest._id and bom_ref.

inputFields.name: supplier
inputFields.description: The organization that supplied the component. The supplier may often be the manufacturer, but may also be a distributor or repackager.

inputFields.name: author
inputFields.description: The person(s) or organization(s) that authored the component.

inputFields.name: publisher
inputFields.description: The person(s) or organization(s) that published the component.

inputFields.name: group
inputFields.description: The grouping name or identifier. This will often be a shortened, single name of the company or project that produced the component, or the source package or domain name. Whitespace and special characters should be avoided. Examples: apache, org.apache.commons, and apache.org.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The name of the component. This will often be a shortened, single name of the component. Examples: commons-lang3 and jquery

inputFields.name: version
inputFields.description: The component version. The version should ideally comply with semantic versioning but is not enforced.

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: Specifies a description for the component.

inputFields.name: scope
inputFields.description: Specifies the scope of the component.

inputFields.name: hashes
inputFields.description: Hashes of the component.

inputFields.name: licenses
inputFields.description: Licenses of the component.

inputFields.name: copyright
inputFields.description: A copyright notice informing users of the underlying claims to copyright ownership in a published work.

inputFields.name: purl
inputFields.description: Specifies the package-url (purl). The purl, if specified, MUST be valid and conform to the specification defined at: https://github.com/package-url/purl-spec

inputFields.name: swid

inputFields.name: external_references

inputFields.name: properties
inputFields.description: Provides the ability to document properties in a name-value store. This provides flexibility to include data not officially supported in the standard without having to use additional namespaces or create extensions. Unlike key-value stores, properties support duplicate names, each potentially having different values. Property names of interest to the general public are encouraged to be registered in the CycloneDX Property Taxonomy (https://github.com/CycloneDX/cyclonedx-property-taxonomy). Formal registration is OPTIONAL.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
